summary: This document is an email chain between FBI personnel and an Office Services Supervisor regarding the logistics of allowing defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell to review evidence stored in a Bronx warehouse. The emails discuss scheduling a viewing for the week of April 12, 2021, and arranging subsequent transport of selected items to 500 Pearl Street for Maxwell's review.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking desk, initiates the email chain to arrange a defense evidence review.

persons.name: Office Services Supervisor (OSS)
persons.context: The OSS for evidence in the New York Field Office coordinates the logistics for the defense attorneys to view evidence in the Bronx warehouse and arrange transport to 500 Pearl.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defense attorneys are reviewing evidence on her behalf, and selected items are to be transported to 500 Pearl Street for her viewing.

connections.description: They are coordinating logistics for evidence review and transport as part of the Ghislaine Maxwell case preparation.
The OSS is facilitating the process by which Maxwell's defense team can review evidence for her case.

events.title: Defense Evidence Review Scheduled
events.description: Defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell are scheduled to review evidence stored at a Bronx warehouse, with selected items to be transported to 500 Pearl Street for Maxwell's viewing.

locations: 500 Pearl Street (location for Ghislaine Maxwell's evidence review, likely a detention or court facility)
keyFacts: The FBI was coordinating with an Office Services Supervisor to allow Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to review evidence in a Bronx warehouse during the week of April 12, 2021.
The defense attorneys would first view items in a hallway area of the warehouse, not in the main evidence space.
Selected evidence items were to be transported to 500 Pearl Street for Ghislaine Maxwell's personal review.
The communication highlights the procedural steps taken in 2021 to facilitate defense access to evidence in Maxwell's criminal case.
